intro: Askellia flexuosa var. tenuifolia, commonly known as the slender-leaved askellia, is a species native to South America, particularly Brazil. It is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
